UI_visible_response: For example, when some netizens' posts were deleted or blocked, they would say that their posts had been "river - crabbed," meaning they were harmonized or censored. This term reflects the unique language creativity and subversive humor of Chinese netizens in the face of online censorship, as well as their attention and thinking on related social phenomena.
traffic_visible_response: 正在搜索找到 9 篇资料参考"River Crab Society" is a term that emerged in the Chinese online cultural context.The term "river crab" (hé xiè) is a homophone for "harmony" (hé xié) in Mandarin Chinese. It was initially used to describe the situation where online posts or content were subject to censorship in the name of maintaining a "harmonious society". Later, it was extended to satirize some phenomena where power - holders imposed their so - called "social harmony" by suppressing different voices.For example, when some netizens' posts were deleted or blocked, they would say that their posts had been "river - crabbed," meaning they were harmonized or censored. This term reflects the unique language creativity and subversive humor of Chinese netizens in the face of online censorship, as well as their attention and thinking on related social phenomena.
